docs.lead_paragraph: While customer satisfaction with banks over all remained unchanged in the fourth quarter of last year from the year-earlier period, customer satisfaction with some of the biggest banks has declined to the lowest fourth-quarter levels in years, according to a new study released Tuesday.

headline.main: Customer Satisfaction With the Biggest Banks Plummets

docs.abstract: While customer satisfaction with banks overall remained unchanged in the fourth quarter of last year from the year earlier period, customer satisfaction with some of the biggest banks has declined to the lowest fourth-quarter levels in years, according to a new study.

docs.lead_paragraph: "Ask an Expert" is a recurring feature on Bucks where you have the opportunity to question big-brained individuals about a particular area of personal finance or consumer affairs.

headline.main: Answers About Freelancers and Taxes: Part 1

docs.abstract: Howard Samuels, a certified public accountant, answers questions on freelancers and the unique issues they face when filing taxes.
docs.snippet: Howard Samuels, a certified public accountant, answers questions on freelancers and the unique issues they face when filing taxes.

docs.lead_paragraph: A variety of consumer-focused articles appear daily in The New York Times and online in our blogs. Each weekday morning, we gather them together here so you can quickly scan the news that could hit your wallet.
docs.abstract: A requirement that stock and insurance brokers act in their customers' best interest, fighting back against an airline on Twitter and other consumer-focused items from Tuesday's Times.
docs.snippet: A requirement that stock and insurance brokers act in their customers' best interest, fighting back against an airline on Twitter and other consumer-focused items from Tuesday's Times.

docs.lead_paragraph: Church Shooting Victims Cooperate | The police said that two teenage brothers were cooperating to help identify the three hooded men who walked into a Richmond church Sunday during a packed service and opened fire, hitting the two brothers, who are 14 and 19. Last week, another daytime shooting claimed the life of a 23-year-old woman.  "We are very concerned about the brazen level of these daytime attacks," said Sgt. Bisa French.  ﻿Nat Bates, a Richmond city councilman, said he would try to reinstate a local ordinance allowing the police to randomly search vehicles for weapons. [The San Francisco Chronicle, Richmond Confidential]
